title: Sandbox R code
text:
This Quarto website was rendered on GitHub 2024-03-06 11:24:27 at UTC time.
The following code is focused on connecting R on GitHub to external data sources.
I test R code to:

Read a public shared googlesheet from Google Drive ‚úÖ
Download and read a public shared .xlsx file from Google Drive ‚úÖ
Write and upload a .rds file to Google Drive
Download and read a public shared .rds file from Google Drive ‚úÖ
Read data from an external API, Star Wars ‚úÖ
Read data from an external API, Weather forecast
Read and download files from private Google Drive, with authentication


Read a public shared googlesheet from Google Drive

library(googlesheets4)
library(gt)

googlesheets4::gs4_deauth()     # Without auth

spreadsheet_url <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1dnzTx2TIxk-QpoWNz08Jr_e4F2rZ4mDBgphzq9lwdYM/edit?usp=drive_link"
datatable <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(spreadsheet_url, range = "Ark1!A1:D5")

datatable |> gt()                        # print my datatable

Download and read a public shared .xlsx file from Google Drive
Write and upload a .rds file to Google Drive

library(googledrive)
library(readxl)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
library(gt)

googledrive::drive_deauth()     # Without auth

# Download and read a public shared `.xlsx` file from Google Drive

file_url <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1AIAkWHGig6a0zG-iYH0Lj9PC2fLmfja5/edit?usp=drive_link&ouid=110726128853064340139&rtpof=true&sd=true"
googledrive::drive_download(as_id(file_url), path = "test_xlsx.xlsx", overwrite = TRUE) # download file

file <- readxl::read_xlsx("test_xlsx.xlsx") # read file
file |> gt() # print my datatable

Remarks

# Write and upload a .rds file to Google Drive

file_upload_url <- "https://drive.google.com/file/d/1voHotEwiiGGi-nc_HrMkw6Cmitw007wG/view?usp=drive_link"
#file_upload <- file |> 
#  dplyr::mutate(Remarks = paste("Table in rds written at ", Sys.time())) |>
#  readr::write_rds("test_rds_upload.rds")

# googledrive::drive_put(file_upload, path = as_id(file_upload_url)) # upload file

googledrive::drive_download(as_id(file_upload_url), path = "test_rds_upload.rds", overwrite = TRUE) # download file again

file <- readr::read_rds("test_rds_upload.rds") # read file
file |> gt() # print my datatable

Download and read a public shared .rds file from Google Drive

library(googledrive)
library(readr)
library(gt)

googledrive::drive_deauth()     # Without auth

file_url <- "https://drive.google.com/file/d/1tADUi-z8sH6B8ByvZKWXVMcSNVQUP2_H/view?usp=drive_link"
googledrive::drive_download(as_id(file_url), path = "test_rds.rds", overwrite = TRUE) # download file

file <- readr::read_rds("test_rds.rds") # read file
file |> gt() # print my datatable

Read data from an external API: The Star Wars API

library(httr2)
library(tidyr)
library(gt)

resp_json <- 
  httr2::request("https://swapi.dev/api/people/") |>
  httr2::req_perform() |>
  httr2::resp_body_json(simplifyVector = TRUE)

name_people <- 
  resp_json$results$name |>  tidyr::as_tibble()
name_people |> gt()








value




Luke Skywalker


C-3PO


R2-D2


Darth Vader


Leia Organa


Owen Lars


Beru Whitesun lars


R5-D4


Biggs Darklighter


Obi-Wan Kenobi

Read a googlesheet from private Google Drive

library(googledrive)
library(googlesheets4)
library(dplyr)
library(gt)


# Google Authentication
googledrive::drive_auth(
  scopes = "https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive.readonly")
gs4_auth(token = drive_token())

# Get Google Sheet ID
ss <- googledrive::drive_get("hv8_planter_sheet")

# ss can be url???
# Read data from Google Sheet
data <- googlesheets4::read_sheet(ss, sheet = "content")

data |> gt()

title: About
text:
With GitHub Actions on GitHub I can:

install Quarto + R and the correct versions of each R package you need (yml file)
render a Quarto project (not render any files locally!) (yml file)
publish a Quarto project on GitHub Pages (yml file)
execute R code and content in qmd files

Here is my Workflow for a Quarto website using GitHub Pages and GitHub Actions.
Workflow - setting things up:

Create Quarto website project with git and renv in RStudio on my Mac.
Commit with Sourcetree ??
Create my new repository on GitHub with usethis::use_github() in RStudio in my R project (My GitHub token used in gitcreds::gitcreds_set() controls which GitHub account is used)
On GitHub in my new repository: main -> View all branches -> Create a branch -> ‚Äúgh-pages‚Äù
In RStudio create txt file publish.yaml file in new folders .github/workflows. Copy/paste complete example of a GitHub Action into publish.yaml
Commit with Sourcetree
Push to GitHub in in RStudio
On GitHub in my new repository:

Pages -> Branch -> change from ‚Äúmain‚Äù to ‚Äúgh-pages‚Äù and save
Top bar -> Actions, - here I can follow the ‚Äúpages build and deployment‚Äù and then I go to visit the website üôÇ

(notice that I have not rendered locally at all)

Workflow:

Write R code and content in qmd files
Call renv::snapshot() to save the state of my project libraries in renv.lock
Commit with Sourcetree
Push to GitHub in in RStudio
From here GitHub Actions runs automatically. It

runs the R code
renders the Quarto website
publishes the Quarto website on GitHub Pages


Resources:

Quarto: GitHub Pages, Executing Code
ggnot2 on YouTube: Publish a Quarto project using GitHub Pages+GitHub Actions in 6 minutes (no need to render locally!)
Article: How to Use GitHub Actions with R to Run Code Automatically

title: GitHub Actions
text:
This is a sandbox Quarto website using GitHub Actions to:

run R code within Quarto on Github
publish a Quarto website on GitHub Pages

Use cases:

run R scrips remotely and document when the code has been executed
produce and publish a report automatically on a schedule
‚Ä¶
